Award.AwardTitle: Commutative Algebra Conference for Young Researchers
Award.AbstractNarration:
This award supports participation by graduate students and postdoctoral researchers in the conference "Upcoming Researchers in Commutative Algebra" (URICA-KUMUNU Jr) to be held in Lincoln, Nebraska on April 25-26th, 2020 and in April 2021. The KUMUNU Jr conference series, of which this will be the ninth, brings together mathematics graduate students and postdocs in the Midwest. This meeting in commutative algebra is being hosted by the Department of Mathematics at the University of Nebraska-Lincoln.

The conference will feature thirteen talks given by early-career commutative algebraists. Building on the success of the KUMUNU conference series, KUMUNU Jr has been a successful way to bring together junior researchers from the Great Plains region, now stretching from Utah to Michigan and North Dakota to Texas, to share their research and expertise while building lasting collaborations. The Upcoming Researchers in Commutative Algebra conference will continue to promote interaction among a diverse group of junior researchers, graduate students, and postdocs, while branching outside the initial triad of sponsors, the University of Kansas, the University of Missouri, and the University of Nebraska.

Visit http://www.math.unl.edu/~shong3/URICA20/index.html for more information.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

Institution.Name: University of Nebraska-Lincoln
Institution.ORG_LGL_BUS_NAME: BOARD OF REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF NEBRASKA

ProgramReference.Text: EXP PROG TO STIM COMP RES

POR.DRECONTENT:
Inspired by the success of the KUMUNU commutative algebra conferences (named after the host institutions of Kansas, Missouri, and Nebraska), the annually recurring KUMUNUjr conferences were launched in 2012 with the aim of bringing together graduate students and postdoctoral scholars studying commutative algebra in the midwest to share their research and with the aim of building lasting collaborations. The conference series was rebranded as URiCA (Upcoming Researchers in Commutative Algebra) starting in 2022.

This grant funded two installments of the URiCA conferences, occurring in May 2022 and May 2023, in Lincoln, Nebraska on the campus of the University of Nebraska. (These conferences were originally scheduled for 2020 and 2021, but were postponed due to the COVID pandemic.) 


The speakers for the 2022 conference were:

  • Vaibhav Pandey (Purdue University)
  • Kailey Perry (University of Arkansas)
  • Kyle Maddox (University of Kansas)
  • Andrew Soto-Levins (University of Nebraska-Lincoln)
  • Dylan Beck (University of Kansas)
  • Ritika Nair (University of Kansas)
  • C. Eric Overton-Walker (University of Arkansas)

The speakers for the 2023 conference were:

  • Emanuela Marangone (University of Notre Dame)
  • Hunter Simper (Purdue University)
  • Jake Kettinger (University of Nebraska-Lincoln)
  • Joey Forsman (North Dakota State University)
  • Joshua Rice (Iowa State University)
  • Keller VandeBogert (University of Notre Dame)
  • Matt Weaver (University of Notre Dame)
  • Sasha Pevzner (University of Minnesota Twin Cities)
  • Souvik Dey (University of Kansas)
  • Trevor Arrigoni (University of Kansas)


Each conference also featured a panel discussion focusing on careers in academia and industry.  The 2022 conference hosted a total of 39 participants, and there were 55 participants for the 2023 conference. Most of the participants came from institutions in the mid-west (broadly interpreted).

 


Last Modified: 03/22/2024
Modified by: Mark E Walker
